Posts.Content: KateG, What side effects did you have, if any, from the Tamoxifen?  I was on it and had periods, some very bad, some lasted a few weeks and then maybe not so I never knew when I was safe. Also very tired most of the time although do try and swim/gym/walk dogs to keep active as am also arthritic and was also struggling with weight.  I was changed to  anastrozole (Arimidex®), after 18 months and the removal of polyps and D&C didn't stop the periods but now still getting them and all other symptoms on the new drugs.   I'm seeing hte consultant again and asking if I can just stop taking them as my chances only improve 5% with them.  DId they give you choices with percentages of treatments?
Posts.Title: 5 years clear

Posts.Content: Wendy, at the Rosie, the breast unit at Addenbrookes in Cambridge, they give you a heart-shaped cusion after the op to put under your arm when you have the drain in.  I wonder if they do that at any of the other specialist units.
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...

Posts.Content: Wendy they also give you a bag that hangs over your shoulder to put the drain in.  I still have my bag and cushion and if you would like the cushion and there is time to post it I can do so.
Posts.Title: Age 37 shock at breast clinic yesterday. totally dazed and reeling...
